flawed_nl_solution:
At the end of the first year, there will be $100 * (110/100) = $<<100*110/100=1000/11>>1000/11 in the bank account.
At the end of the second year, there will be $1000/11 * (110/100) = $<<1000/11*(110/100)=100>>100
#### 100

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 110, not 1000/11. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
